alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 28 at 8:20AM PDT until March 28 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 2500 feet. Additional snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Douglas County Foothills and Jackson County above 2500 feet. This includes Butte Falls, Prospect, Jacksonville Hill on Highway 238, and Highway 227 north of Shady Cove. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of strong winds and snow will result in reduced visibilities and occasional whiteout conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
